p: The results outlined regarding E. angustifolium having the highest TPC and TFC quantities were not supported by the work of Vukajlović et al. [ 65], who was able to show that E. vulgare presented the highest total antioxidative capacity (TAC) followed by E. italicum and E. rubrum. Although E. rubrum showed the least TAC in these investigations, this species had more significant results in the DPPH, FRAP, and reducing power assays with 78.18 ± 8.73 mg TE/g DW, 122.07 ± 11.30 mg TE/g DW and 638.74 ± 65.40 mg BHTE/g, respectively. There is disagreement within the literature regarding which species has the more antioxidative capacity and presents an opportunity for further investigation.
